title: Woodes Rogers
summary: Woodes Rogers (c. 1679 – 15 July 1732) was an English sea captain, privateer, slave trader[1] and, from 1718, the first Royal Governor of the Bahamas. He is known as the captain of the vessel that rescued marooned Alexander Selkirk, whose plight is generally believed to have inspired Daniel Defoe's Robinson Crusoe.
